sentences: Kaarel jäi mõtlema. Tõepoolest, ega teistelgi [külmade tõttu] paremat pauku ole.
Tema on alati otsinud paremat lahendust.
Me peame leidma paremat viisi probleemi lahendamiseks.
context: The word 'paremat' is the comparative form of the Estonian adjective 'parem', meaning 'better'. It is used to compare two things and indicates that something has improved quality or is superior in some way compared to another option. In the example sentence, it refers to not having any better options available.
